document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Blastobasis Zeller, 1855 (Lepidoptera: Blastobasidae) from China, with descriptions of six new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Blastobasis Zeller, 1855 (Lepidoptera: Blastobasidae) from China, with descriptions of six new species

bibRefCitation.author: Park, K. T.
bibRefCitation.refString: Park, K. T. (1984) Description of two new species of Blastobasidae (Lepidoptera) from Korea. Korean Journal of Plant Protection, 23 (1), 56 - 60.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Blastobasis sprotundalis
Park, 1984: 57
. Type locality: Korea . Type deposited: CIS.

Diagnosis . Adult ( Fig. 4 ) forewing length 4.5–6.5 mm .
Blastobasis sprotundalis
is similar to
B. parki Sinev, 1986
and
B. drymosa
Adamski & Li, 2010
in the male genitalia by the dorsal part of the valva having costal process with a row of elongate spine-like setae, and a transverse, bandlike juxta. It can be separated from
B. parki
and
B. drymosa
in the male genitalia by the gnathos lacking medial denticles on the posterior margin ( Fig. 14 ), whereas the gnathos has two medial denticles on the posterior margin of the latter two species. In the female genitalia,
B. sprotundalis
can be separated from
B. parki
and
B. drymosa
by the eighth sternum having a darkly pigmented posterior spot medially ( Fig. 24 ), whereas the latter two species lack a pigmented spot.

Distribution . China ( Anhui , Beijing , Chongqing , Fujian , Gansu , Guangdong , Guizhou , Hebei , Heilongjiang , Henan , Hubei , Hunan , Inner Mongolia , Jilin , Liaoning , Shandong , Shanxi , Sichuan , Tianjin , Zhejiang ), Japan ( Hokkaido , Honshu, Kyushu, Shikoku), Korea (Gwangreung, Muju, Suweon, Weonju), Russia ( Primorsky Krai ).
